page.title: 02The Tollerton Area continued
page.content: The railway line from Kings Cross Station,London to Waverley Station,Edinburgh runs through Tollerton. Industry in Tollerton is mostly connected with joinery.One joiner is the Village Undertaker and one firm specialises in fencing.Previous industries were brick making,tile making,malting and corn milling.They have disappeared now but were important at the time.There is a Post Office, a small supermarket,three public houses and a garage. West of Tollerton is a small hamlet called Youlton.Youlton is a group of small eighteenth century houses and farm buildings.Youlton Hall is a house of historical interest.The Hall was built in 1340.It was timber framed but it has since been clad in brick.You can see the dip of a previous moat.
